medical_history.chief_complaint: Recurrent goiter and pain at the right upper thigh.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced recurrent goiter since 1.5 years old, with initial detection of a slowly growing lower neck swelling at that time. The first medical intervention occurred at age 5 years, followed by multiple thyroid surgeries due to gradual recurrence, with the last surgery at age 15 years resulting in a diagnosis of thyroid cancer. Pain in the right upper thigh presented at the time of hospital admission in June 2002.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient underwent partial thyroidectomy at age 5, another thyroid surgery at age 7, and partial bilateral thyroidectomy at age 15, with a diagnosis of metastatic follicular thyroid carcinoma.
medical_history.family_history: Significant for a brother with a similar condition of recurrent goiter, also having had two thyroid surgeries at ages 6 and 14.
